title: Remake system
body:
Dear Riot, 
As i was loading into a ranked game my client crashed so I launched the launcher and everything was fine but as soon as i got into game i was able to cast my vote toward the remake system and i thought everything was fine since it was voted 2 yes and 3 no's but a couple seconds later the surrender vote went through, and I was punished for "leaving" or being a "leaver", now i know i wasn't initially there for the start of the game but if i am able to rejoin the game before the votes finished and even cast my own vote why would the game restart and punish me? even after the votes were 2-3 ( 2 being yes and 3 being no's). I do not personally know if this is supposed to happen or not so i wanted to bring it up. And please do not give a copy pasted response by saying you did not connect to the game leaving your team at a disadvantage etc. It just does not make sense that the remake was made even though i was able to join and cast a vote making it a 2-3 decision.

replies.body: Why on earth you don't need a majority to vote for yes in a remake situation? And why on earth isn't a majority enough for a surrender vote? Does no one in here notice the incoherence here?

We don't use copy/pastas here on H&S, so here's a response, fresh off the press!

The way the remake system works is that it looks for any players that are *inactive* for 90+ seconds within the first 3 minutes of the game. If anyone is marked by the time the 3:00 mark rolls by, a remake vote begins and requires 30% of the team to vote "*yes" for the remake to go through. In a 4v5 (one person marked) it only takes 2 votes to pass. I suggest checking out our [**/Remake FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208754686--Remake-FAQ) for more details on how the system works.

Let me know if you have any questions.
In 4v5s, only 2 yes's are required to remake a game. In a 3v5, 2v5, or 2v3, only 1 yes is required to remake a game.
